item.title: SOPA: Tale of the Stolen Potato launches October 7
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Search for Grandma’s lost soup ingredients.

Emotional narrative adventure game SOPA: Tale of the Stolen Potato will launch for Xbox Series, Xbox One, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on October 7, developer StudioBando announced. It will also be available via Xbox Game Pass.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

When Miho steps into the pantry to get a potato for his grandmothers’ soup, he’s pulled into a distant fantastical land where he must retrace the steps of a mysterious great traveler before him.

He must venture through a world of endless deserts, floating mountains, and talking beasts, outsmarting thieves and meeting quirky characters along the way.

But each time he returns to the kitchen with an ingredient, he’s a little bit taller, and his grandmother a little bit older…

Key Features

  • Beautiful narrative adventure inspired by Spirited Away, The Little Prince, and Coco.
  • Explore fantastic original worlds in full 3D Disney / Pixar-like art style.
  • Laugh-out-loud dialogue pulls you into the world.
  • Emotional subtext for a mature audience, while being fun and accessible to a younger one.
  • Solve puzzles, engage in quick-time events, learn songs.
  • Designed for multiplatform and accessibility.
  • 10 to 12-plus hours of gameplay.
  • Complete all sidequests and collect all the clay figurines!
  • Meet new characters and go on new adventures in upcoming downloadable content.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: POOLS coming to PS5, PS VR2 on November 25
item.content:encoded:
• PS VR2
  • PS5

Currently available for PC.

Tensori will release backrooms pools game POOLS for PlayStation 5 with PlayStation VR2 support on November 25, the developer announced. A demo is available now via PlayStation Store. It is currently flatscreen-only, but will be updated with PlayStation VR2 support in the near future.

POOLS first launched for PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, GOG, and itch.io on April 26, 2024.

The PlayStation 5 version will launch with the base game, the “Chapter 0” expansion, and the PlayStation VR2 mode.

Here is an overview of the game, via Tensori:

POOLS invites players into a world of vast, deserted public swimming spaces and submerged corridors, blending haunting liminal architecture with the soothing and at times unsettling presence of emptiness. Is someone watching you? Are they there with you? Is this perhaps just a dream? You’re never quite sure.

Developed by Tensori, a team of four in Finland, POOLS became an unexpected phenomenon after its debut. It went on to win the “Best Creative Achievement of the Year” at the Finnish Game Awards, earned a 95 percent “Overwhelmingly Positive” rating on Steam, and allowed the developers at Tensori to turn their passion project into a sustainable studio.

PlayStation 5 players will be able to play the original POOLS game and the “Chapter 0” expansion, both in flatscreen and on PlayStation VR2. The PlayStation VR2 mode will also be available for free.

item.title: Blue Protocol: Star Resonance launches October 9
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Smartphone

Commemorative music video celebrates over 29,000 closed beta players.

Cross-platform anime-style RPG Blue Protocol: Star Resonance will launch for PC via Steam and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play on October 9, publisher A PLUS JAPAN and developer BOKURA announced. Pre-registration is available now.

Get the latest details below.

A Heartfelt Thank-You to Our Beta Testers

The recent closed beta test was met with an incredible response, drawing over 29,000 players into the world of Regnus. The development team extends its deepest gratitude to all participants. Their valuable feedback is being actively used to polish and improve the game for the official launch. To celebrate the community’s spirit, a special commemorative video has been created, featuring players’ best moments from the beta, featuring the game’s official English theme song, “Starlight Over Asterleeds ~星々が輝く場所~”.

Unlock Exclusive Crunchyroll Member Benefits

Adventuring in Blue Protocol: Star Resonance with a Crunchyroll Membership is better! Upon launch, players with any Crunchyroll Membership tier—new and existing—can log in with their credentials to receive exclusive in-game rewards, including avatar frames, mount skins, and more to customize their adventure. Stay-tuned for more details on official channels.

What is Blue Protocol: Star Resonance?

For those new to the world of Regnus, Blue Protocol: Star Resonance offers a rich MMORPG experience defined by several key highlights:

  • Anime-Styled Visuals – Stunning graphics create an immersive anime-style world while preserving the high-quality visuals of Project Skyblue.
  • Dynamic Combat System – Class system, talent build, skill sets, and equipment enable personalized combat style customization, with iterative content updates actively diversifying the approaches.
  • Open World – Explore expansive landscapes filled with quests, dungeons, and epic raids.
  • Deep Character Customization – Expand character customization, enabling players to craft their own distinct personalities.
  • Multiplayer Social Experience – Trade, guilds, and community events enhance the multiplayer experience.

Watch the new music video below.

item.title: Valheim coming to PS5 in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Currently in Early Access for Xbox Series, Xbox One, and PC.

Coffee Stain Publishing and developer Iron Gate Studio will release Viking survival game Valheim for PlayStation 5 in 2026, the companies announced.

Valheim first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on February 2, 2021, followed by Xbox Series and Xbox One on March 14, 2023.

“We’re thrilled for Valheim to soon reach even more players with the upcoming launch on PlayStation,” said Iron Gate Studio co-founder Henrik Tornqvist in a press release. “Bringing both new and longtime players to a new platform allows even more people to explore the world we’ve worked so hard to build, and we can’t wait to hear their stories as they’re able to dive into their Viking adventures.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Coffee Stain Publishing:

Valheim is a survival and exploration game for one-to-10 players, set in a procedurally-generated purgatory inspired by Viking culture. Developed by Sweden-based indie studio Iron Gate and published by Coffee Stain Publishing, the team behind other hit titles such as Satisfactory and Deep Rock Galactic, the game challenges players to battle, build and carve out their legacy in the tenth realm. Since its meteoric Early Access debut in 2021, Valheim has earned widespread acclaim, boasting a 94 percent “Very Positive” rating on Steam with more than 477,000 positive reviews and over 12 million copies sold.

Valheim has continued to expand throughout its Early Access with a series of updates, including but not limited to:

  • “Hearth & Home” enhanced core survival and base-building mechanics, enabling players to create the longhouse of their dreams.
  • “Mistlands” introduced a mysterious, fog-shrouded biome filled with dangerous creatures and a magic system to master, while the fiery
  • “Ashlands” update challenged players to navigate treacherous cliffs and boiling waters teeming with slithering threats.
  • “Call To Arms,” unveiled during IGN’s Gamescom showcase, delivered a major combat system update, along with new enemies, weapons, armor sets, and crafting materials

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Red Dunes Games announces TGS 2025 lineup, including new games by ACQUIRE
item.content:encoded:
Introducing Monster Eater and Hamrazu:Re.

Red Dunes Games has announced its games lineup for Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

“Returning to [Tokyo Game Show] this year is both exciting and meaningful for us,” said Red Dune Games CEO Sultan Darmaki in a press release. “What began with just a handful of booths last year has grown into one of the largest presences at the show, reflecting the trust of our partners and the passion of our teams. Our lineup highlights the balance we believe in: pairing flagship titles with standout indie games that deserve the spotlight. At Red Dunes, our focus remains the same, supporting both established and emerging creators and delivering experiences that are fun, meaningful, and shared with our partners and fans.”

The Red Dunes Games booth will feature a curated lineup of 12 games playable across 32 high-performance PCs, powered by sponsor GALLERIA. While all playable games will be showcased on PC, console versions are also planned.

The publisher’s games lineup is as follows:

  • Blades of Mirage – A highly epic imaginative isometric RPG set in a Southeast Asian-inspired world. As Mira, use your ability to create water-based weapons and utilize your strongest strategies to defeat the guardians and secure the treasures. Explore ancient ruins scattered across unique islands, confront corrupted, powerful creatures and solve intricate puzzles to secure the ancient relics.
  • Katuba’s Poacher – South Korean one-man developer / studio Joe Yu shows off his exceptional talent. Katuba’s Poacher is a boss-rush cartoon action challenge, with a subtle blend of roguelite, action and ‘arcade boss battles’ elements. You are on a quest to defeat bosses in battles that play out like musical acts, brought to life in a hand-drawn, 2D cartoon fantasy world.
  • LightSup! – A couch action beat ’em up cooperative game for one-to-four players with roguelite elements. Encounter hordes of ferocious monsters crawling from the dungeons and forest. Prepare your weapons, worship the Altar of Lights to illuminate your path, and cleanse the Lumineia Kingdom from the Eclipse and its eternal darkness.
  • Nightmare Circus – Find your friends and escape the nightmare in the award-nominated Nightmare Circus which is an enthralling action-adventure game where you take on the role of a Puppeteer trapped in the Nightmare Realm. Employ an array of tools for creating satisfying collisions to smash, crash, and slam into enemies, obstacles, and danger; create your play style to deal with the many nightmares that roam the land!
  • Port of Jumanah – A 2.5D action-adventure with roguelite elements, Port of Jumanah follows Mansour on a surreal journey beneath the waves. Inspired by the United Arab Emirates’ pearl diving heritage, the game blends fast-paced combat, whimsical storytelling, and a richly imagined underwater world filled with secrets to uncover.
  • Princess of the Water Lilies – A hand-drawn 2D puzzle-platformer where a cat, frogs, and other creatures bring a whimsical world to life. Explore beautifully crafted environments inspired by classic animated tales from the 70s to the 90s.
  • Samurai Pizza Cats: Blast from the Past! – Announced early in the year to wild and enthusiastic feedback. This iconic intellectual property, backed fully by the owners/creators of the original Samurai Pizza Cats TV series! This is one very sought after title! Take control of the Pizza Cats and prevent The Big Cheese from taking over Little Tokyo once and for all in this 2D action-packed adventure.
  • Silent Planet: Elegy of a Dying World – The year is 2997. Steel yourself with your Asimov Plasma Blade and harness the power of the ancient Psionic Disciplines in Silent Planet, an exploration-focused, gothic science-fiction Metroidvania rooted in cosmic horror—a mix of genres seamlessly conjoined to create a game of mature intrigue! You play as Apranik. Your mission is to travel to the planet Thulcandra in search of a crucial item: the Angel’s Egg. Explore the claustrophobic corridors of a massive underground complex filled with the remnants of technological and biological horrors created by a dead civilization.
  • Zozo and the Lost Dreams – A light-hearted 2D Metroidvania platformer about Zozo, a young boy trapped in a dream world. Join Zozo as he explores the bizarre dream world packed with quirky characters, peculiar enemies, funny stories, and surprises that’ll keep you on your toes. With a neat storyline, humorous narratives, and a colourful and vibrant world, this is an indie game with plenty of appeal!

The following three games developed by ACQUIRE will also be featured:

Monster Eater

In a city haunted by urban legends, anomalies lurk in the shadows. To survive, you must hunt them—or be consumed.

Hamrazu:Re

A time loop begins aboard a train bound for destiny. Each rewind uncovers new secrets, but the clock is always ticking.

Codename: Project Tremor

When colossal threats rise, the fight to reclaim everyday life begins.

According to the press release, these projects “mark just the beginning of Red Dunes’ growing partnership with ACQUIRE,” and ACQUIRE will share “further announcements” on September 19.

Watch a sizzle reel for Red Dunes Games’ lineup below.

item.title: Ripple Island remake Ripple Island: Kyle and Cal’s Restaurant announced for Switch 2, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch 2

Due out on November 27.

SUNSOFT has announced Ripple Island: Kyle and Cal’s Restaurant, a full 3D remake of its 1988-released adventure game Ripple Island. It will launch for Switch 2 and PC via Steam on November 27 for 4,378 yen with English, French, Italian, German, Spanish, Japanese, Korean, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language support.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

The restaurant is bustling with customers!

Ripple Island: Kyle and Cal’s Restaurant is a cooperative cooking action game for up to 16 players.

Team up with the unique animals of Ripple Island to serve up delicious dishes!

To cook any dish, you first need to gather ingredients.

Grow vegetables, catch fish, collect eggs from your pets… Gather ingredients in all sorts of ways and show off your cooking skills!

Story

Upon an unknown sea floats an unknown island: Ripple Island.

Surrounded by rich nature, the island was blessed with an abundance of fresh, delicious ingredients and was home to many skilled chefs.

Then one day, a question popped into the head of the island’s king, Dotella:

“What is the most delicious dish on this island?”

To find the answer, King Dotella issued a proclamation to all the chefs on the island:

“A cooking tournament will be held to decide the greatest chef on the island! Whoever creates the best dish will be rewarded with a grand treasure!”

This proclamation reached the ears of Kyle, a chef living on the outskirts of the island.

Kyle, who had always dreamed of making it big, immediately got ready and set off for the castle where the tournament would be held.

Key Features

  • Challenge Mode
    • In Challenge Mode, you can play with up to four players in local cooperative play.
    • Work together with your family and friends to beat each stage!
  • Everyone’s Restaurant
    • Enjoy massive cooperative fun with up to 16 players online!
    • Teamwork and dividing tasks are the keys to conquering up to six stages within the time limit!
    • You can also have up to eight local players join an online session together!
    • Jump into online multiplayer and have a blast with your family and friends!
  • Various Ways to Play
    • Solo Play
      • From gathering ingredients to cooking, serving, and cleaning, you’ll do it all by yourself.
      • Aim for victory by making the best decisions while running the entire operation solo!
    • 16-Player Cooperative Play
      • You won’t clear these stages without delegating roles!
      • The key to success is to watch your teammates’ actions and figure out the best way you can contribute.

And now… Let’s get cooking!

Watch the announcement trailer below. Visit the official website here.

Announce Trailer
